name: places/ChIJ-zpbpiP2wokRblUgWD-szz8
formattedAddress: 928 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 928 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

originalText.text: Great gym. Very friendly, easy going vibe. The instruction is top notch and the emphasis is on being very technical. It shows up in the training partners who are very skilled, and you don't risk injury rolling with them. If you're new to BJJ, especially if you're smaller or less athletic, definitely give this gym a try.

originalText.text: Great place for Jiujitsu. It is a very friendly and inviting environment. Also very technical and knowledgeable instructors. I am really enjoying my progression. Adri Burton is a great instructor.

text.text: Great place for Jiujitsu. It is a very friendly and inviting environment. Also very technical and knowledgeable instructors. I am really enjoying my progression. Adri Burton is a great instructor.

originalText.text:
June 2018....  Our 5 year old has been attending class here for 2 years.
We can assure you, the teaching that happens in this dojo, is exceptional.
It is unique.  And very special.
I listen to the teacher when talking to other children, when they don't know I'm listening.  They challenge the students who need it.
(they gently challenge the ones who think they don't want it)
They comfort an unsure student, and are perpetually positive in their words and actions.  Patience is a staple,  at the same time reminding the students to stay focused.  If you have a little one, the teaching technique is completely age appropriate.
And lastly, The owners are so talented, it is very impressive.
We very much appreciate not having to sign a contract.  The flexibility is so family friendly.  Our child loves her teachers here.  And we will continue bringing her there, for as long as she wants.

originalText.text: Nice friendly community of Karate and Brazilian Jiujitsu practitioners. You'll come to an environment where you will learn and improve, whether it's just Kenshikai karate, Brazilian Jiujitsu, or both!
